quiz_one.feedback: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language

quiz_one.questionText: HTML comments start with <!-- and end with -->
quiz_one.feedback: In HTML comments start with <!-- and end with -->

quiz_one.questionText: How can you make a bulleted list with numbers?
quiz_one.feedback: <ol> is used to make ordered lists with numbers

quiz_one.questionText: <h2> is a larger size text than <h1>
quiz_one.feedback: Font size values follow the header hierarchy. h1 has to be bigger than h2, h2 has to be bigger than h3 etc.

quiz_one.questionText: What is the correct HTML tag for inserting a line break?
quiz_one.feedback:
You would use
to insert a line break

quiz_one.questionText: In HTML, the tag _________ is used to insert a horizontal line.
quiz_one.feedback: The <hr> tag is used to insert a horizontal line in HTML.

quiz_one.questionText: What file extension should HTML files have?
quiz_one.feedback: HTML files have the file extension '.html'

quiz_one.questionText:
In HTML, what will be the output of this code?

Here is a heading
quiz_one.feedback: The text surrounded by <!-- and --> is a comment so it will not display on the page. Only the text 'Here is a heading' will be displayed on the page.

quiz_one.questionText: In HTML, which tag is used to create paragraphs?
quiz_one.feedback:
The correct answer is

. The tag is used to display bold text. There is no tag in HTML.

quiz_one.questionText: Assuming that orange.jpg cannot be found, what will be displayed when a page with this code is loaded in the browser?
options: A warning message on the page
A warning message in an alert box
quiz_one.feedback: The alt attribute specifies alternative text to be displayed if an image does not load.

quiz_one.questionText: The attribute 'onclick' is used to set inline styles for tags?
quiz_one.feedback: The attribute style is used to set inline styles for tags

quiz_one.questionText: Which one of the following tags creates a table row?
quiz_one.feedback: The tag <tr> creates a table row. The <td> tag creates a table cell. The <th> tag creates a table heading. The <table> tag creates the table itself

quiz_one.questionText: When using the padding property; are you allowed to use negative values?
quiz_one.feedback: You are not allowed to use negative values for the padding propertyin CSS.

quiz_one.questionText: Which one of these is in the correct HTML format for referring to an external style sheet?
quiz_one.feedback: <link rel= "stylesheet" type= "text/css" href= "mystyle.css">  is in the correct format.

quiz_one.questionText: You can apply multiple CSS Classes to the same element.
quiz_one.feedback: You are allowed to apply more than one CSS class to the same element
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets

quiz_one.questionText: How would you select an element with id 'demo'?
quiz_one.feedback: You would use # when reffering to an element id

quiz_one.questionText: Which CSS property controls the text size?
quiz_one.feedback: In CSS font-size is used to change the text size.

quiz_one.questionText: How do you insert a comment in a CSS file?
quiz_one.feedback: In CSS, /* and */ is used to write comments

quiz_one.questionText: In CSS how do you make a list that lists its items with squares?
quiz_one.feedback: list-style-type can be used to to make lists of different styles.

quiz_two.questionText: In java the ___________ data type is used to create a variable that should store text?
quiz_two.feedback: String is a special data type that is used to store text.

quiz_two.questionText: Java and javascript are the same thing?
quiz_two.feedback: Java and Javascript are two different languages. Java is a language used to create software applications and applets, while Javascript is a scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive content on webpages.

quiz_two.questionText: Which loop type would you use to repeat a task a set number of times?
quiz_two.feedback: The for loop is used to repeat a task a set number of times. The while and do-while loops repeat a segment of code an unknown number of times. Switch is a conditional statement, not a loop.

quiz_two.questionText: The length() method can be used to find the length of a string?
quiz_two.feedback: The length() is used to find the length of a string.

quiz_two.questionText: Which keyword is used to import a package from the Java API library?
quiz_two.feedback: The import keyword is used to import a package, class or interface.

quiz_two.questionText: The ______________ package is imported by default into Java programs?
quiz_two.feedback: The java.lang package provides classes that are fundamental to developing Java programs including the String class and the Math class.

quiz_two.questionText: Which interface should be used by a Java program to be able to play audio files?
quiz_two.feedback: The AudioClip interface is located in the java.applet package and can be used to play audio files.
The charAt() functions returns a character from a string at a specified index. In this case it is index 8 where the 'a' character is located.

quiz_two.questionText: What is the name of the process by which two or more strings are joined together?
quiz_two.feedback: This is achieved with the use of the + operator. You can use concatenation to join two or more strings into one or print two or more strings together.

quiz_two.questionText: Which of the following can be used to access the first element of an array named arrOne?
quiz_two.feedback: Array indexes begin at 0, so the first element of an array is at index 0, the second element at index 1, and so on.

quiz_two.questionText: main() method is used in every Java program?
quiz_two.feedback: The main() method is what makes a Java program work. System.out.print() and System.out.println() are used to print text. There is no type() method in Java.

quiz_two.questionText: Which package needs to be imported so that you can accept user input?
quiz_two.feedback: The java.io package provides classes for input and output for things like interaction with the user and reading and writing to files

quiz_two.questionText: The == operator can be used to compare two values?
quiz_two.feedback: The == operator can be used to compare two values.

quiz_two.questionText: Which keyword would you use if you wanted a class to use an interface?
quiz_two.feedback: To use an interface, use the implements keyword with the name of the interface in the class declaration line in your code.

quiz_two.questionText: In java # can be used to insert comments?
quiz_two.feedback: In java // or /* are used to write comments.

quiz_two.questionText: The _______ operator is used to multiply numbers
quiz_two.feedback: The * is used to multiply numbers.

quiz_two.questionText: Which of the following would you use to test a variable for five different values?
quiz_two.feedback: The switch statement is specifically designed to test one variable for a number of possible values.

quiz_two.questionText: What is it called when an instance of a class is also an instance of its superclass?
quiz_two.feedback: Polymorphism is when an instance of a class is also an instance of its superclass.

quiz_two.questionText: Which of the following snippets of code can be used to instantiate an object?
quiz_two.feedback: Class A = new AClass(); creates an object named A which is an instance of the AClass class.

quiz_two.questionText: Which of the following GUI components can be included in a Java frame?
quiz_two.feedback: Textbox, label, button, images (and more) can all be included in a Java frame.
